item.title: Report E-2024040333
item.description:
Report E-2024040333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 55000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04/11/2024, at 1408 hours, personnel in the CSXT Avon, Indiana Yard reported CTCX 735942, a loaded tank car of Styrene Monomer, Stabilized, leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Americas Styrenics, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-0411-00185). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car leaking from the bottom outlet valve (BOV). HEPACO personnel found that despite the operating handle of the BOV being in the closed position, the valve was partially open; additionally, it was determined that the BOV cap gasket was worn and deteriorated. HEPACO personnel fully closed the valve and replaced the BOV cap gasket. Because the BOV was determined to be faulty or out of adjustment, contractor personnel transferred the contents of the load on-site prior to forwarding in transportation. Subsequent forwarding of the non-conforming car to shop for repair was authorized by OTMA. The issues identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Vince Woolridge, 281-825-9424).
